Class Project1

  • java.lang.Object
    • Project1

  • public class Project1
extends java.lang.Object
    COP3538 Project 1 - Array Searches and Sorts - Summer 2019

    This class is the starting point to the program with the main method and various searching and sorting methods. Upon starting the program the user is prompted with menu with various options. The user can enter a options 1-6, each option does something different. There are 1 print option, 3 sort options, 1 find option, and 1 exit option.

    Option 1, the program will display a list of all of the imported states. The state name, capital, abbreviation, population, region, and the number of US house seats will be displayed.
    Option 2, the states will be sorted by their name using the bubble sort.
    Option 3, the states will be sorted by their population using selection sort.
    Option 4, the states will be sorted by their capital city using insertion sort.
    Option 5, the program will prompt the user to enter a search key and the program will call the findState() method to find the capital matching the specified key.
    Option 6, the program will exit.

    Version:
    1.0, 05/31/2019
    Author:
    Michael Whalen (N01425161)

      • sortByStateName

        private static boolean sortByStateName(int numRecords)
        This method uses the bubble sort to sort the states by their name in alphabetical order.
        Parameters:
        numRecords - Takes in the number of records.
        Returns:
        Returns whether or not the states were sorted by the capital. In this case it is false.

      • soryByPopulation

        private static boolean soryByPopulation(int numRecords)
        This method uses selection sort to sort the array of State objects by population from least to greatest.
        Parameters:
        numRecords - takes in the number of records.
        Returns:
        Returns whether or not the states were sorted by the capital. In this case it is false.

      • sortByCapital

        private static boolean sortByCapital(int numRecords)
        This method uses insertion sort to sort the array of State objects by their capital.
        Parameters:
        numRecords - Takes in the number of records.
        Returns:
        Returns TRUE to specify that the States have been sorted by their capitals.

      • findState

        private static void findState(int numRecords,
                              boolean sortedByCapital,
                              java.lang.String searchKey)
        This method will search for a state's capital that matches the given search key. If the states have been sorted by their capital's, then the method will use binary search to look for the key. If the states have NOT been sorted by their capitals, then the method will use sequential search to look for the provided key.
        Parameters:
        numRecords - Takes in the number of State objects within the array.
        sortedByCapital - Takes in whether or not the states have been sorted by their capitals.
        searchKey - Takes in the key the search algorithm will look for.

      • swap

        private static void swap(int s1,
                         int s2)
        This method is used by the bubble sort and selection sort algorithms. It swaps the location of two objects within the array in order to sort them.
        Parameters:
        s1 - Takes in the index of the first object.
        s2 - Takes in the index of the second object.

      • quit

        private static void quit()
        This method will exit the program when executed. Activated by option 6 in the menu.
